channel.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
channel.description:
Apparently Destructoid has gotten ahold of a leaked trailer. Admittedly, I haven't been interested in a Call of Duty game since Modern Warfare 2. That being said, this one actually looks different for once.
[url]https://www.destructoid.com/call-of-duty-advanced-warfare-leaked-see-the-first-video-and-images-274126.phtml[/url]
Warning: Kevin Spacey may topple your governments. [quote] The official reveal of the next Call of Duty is imminent. We've seen a screenshot out of Game Informer and have a countdown set to go off Sunday morning. But let's not wait for that.
Word has it via an untitled, "leaked" audio recording that actor Kevin Spacey will play a role in the Sledgehammer-developed title. Variety connected the dots using a visualizer on the audio file to come up with an image that looks like a man holding a weapon. His involvement has since been confirmed. And going off that VICE-produced video about private military companies released earlier today, we know the game's general theme.
Through a trusted source, Destructoid has learned the new Call of Duty, subtitled Advanced Warfare, revolves around a soldier of fortune group run by Spacey's character that has turned on the United States government. As shown in the leaked media attached to this post, players will wear exosuits to jump super high, scale buildings, and cloak themselves. Also, hoverbikes. [/quote]

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Advanced Warfare Multiplayer Trailer

Well for the first time in a while I’m optimistic about a CoD game. The jet pack features looks like they’ve really improved the game’s verticality. It looks a lot like Titanfall’s infantry mechanics (which were very enjoyable) however more fleshed out with more variety and, obviously, an infantry focus. This one could be fun, however I’m still not going to hold my breath for good mod support and reasonable DLC ): or the return of wager matches from BO1.

I’ll have to try it out if there’s an open beta.

Read full topic

item.description:
Ghosts ran horrible on everything though right? Even the PS4 and Xbone. Wonder if it’ll still have a 6GB ram lock while only using 2GB and use an insane amount of vram.

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: Diabolical
item.description:
Here are the system requirements for Advanced Warfare which is also identical to Ghosts.

Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare (Source)
OS: Windows 7 64-Bit / Windows 8 64-Bit
HDD : 40GB HD space
Sound: DirectX Compatible Sound Card
DirectX: 11
Internet: Broadband connection and service required for Multiplayer Connectivity. Internet connection required for activation.
CPU: Intel® Core™ 2 Duo E8200 2.66 GHZ / AMD Phenom™ X3 8750 2.4 GHZ or better Recommended: Intel® Core™ i5 – 680 @ 3.6GHz
RAM: 6 GB RAM Recommended: 8 GB RAM
Video: NVIDIA® GeForce™ GTX GTS 450 / ATI® Radeon™ HD 5870 or better Recommended: NVIDIA® GeForce™ GTX 760 @ 4GB

Call of Duty: Ghosts (Source)
OS: Windows 7 64-Bit / Windows 8 64-Bit
HDD : 40GB HD space
Sound: DirectX Compatible Sound Card
DirectX: 11
Internet: Broadband connection and service required for Multiplayer Connectivity. Internet connection required for activation.
CPU: Intel® Core™ 2 Duo E8200 2.66 GHZ / AMD Phenom™ X3 8750 2.4 GHZ or better Recommended: Intel® Core™ i5 – 680 @ 3.6GHz
RAM: 6 GB RAM Recommended: 8 GB RAM
Video: NVIDIA® GeForce™ GTX GTS 450 / ATI® Radeon™ HD 5870 or better Recommended: NVIDIA® GeForce™ GTX 760 @ 4GB

https://kotaku.com/your-pc-must-be-this-advanced-to-run-call-of-duty-adva-1618525485

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: Lemonz_amp_amp_orang
item.description:
Dotard:

I could run Black Ops 2 with no problems, while Modern Warfare 3 was lagging ._.

Anyway, joke name: Crisis Calls: Financial Warfare

i could run cod1,2,4,W@W,mw2,bo1,bo2 without any performance issues

yet mw3 and ghosts (both coincidentally from the puppet-Infinity Ward) lag and look worse than anything

if you think of it, the Old IW only really fucked up on mw2 (by starting that whole CoD stigma thing and fucking over our serverbrowser and mods) and even still it was a decent game (then enter alterIWnet and later all of its clones/revivals, which gave mw2 the proper pc experience); mw3 and ghosts arent made by the same talent at all (even robert bowling has left)
and seeing how Titanfall runs very well and is very responsive on pc, im pretty sure they would’ve done the same had the REAL IW developed mw3

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Maxey:

I’m pretty sure those were taken by himself on his PC, as the MP part of ghosts is going through a free weekend on steam right now.

Pay more attention to things, sersoft.

Anyway, I think that might be an issue with either drivers or corrupted files. Try verifying your files, lemonz.

I knew that was on PC just by the image quality of the screenshot, anyway the PC port of this is so bad the same issues still apply (unless you have an SSD and fast RAM)

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
If this is not caused by the SubD tech, it might be caused by fragmented files on a compact disc, where the laser has to wait until the motor is aligned with the opposite ends of the disc while reading a certain point of view on the map. Basically a poorly optimized game.

960×540 62.7 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
I think the real problem here is their inverse kinematics. It’s clearly having an effect on their lighting. And that horrible anisotropic filtering makes all the models super low-poly!

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
No, man, obviously their modeling tools are to blame here. Modeling tools are what handles LoD and maybe if they knew how to use Photoshop they wouldn’t be having specularity issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Those are separate things from SubD and you straight-up said SubD was directly involved with bad LoD and pop-up.

Even when you bash a bad game, you still need to be fair to it when it has stuff that works as intended.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
item.dc:creator: Lemonz_amp_amp_orang
item.description:
Maxey:

Yeah, FFS, there’s bashing CoD for being terrible games design-wise but then there’s pulling bullshit out of your ass for not knowing what a certain feature of the game is. Lets try to be fair here.

all i see in Ghosts is textures popping into their proper resolutions 5 inches away from the player’s view at Max settings

and that only occurs half the time, other times you get this

but at least that SubD delivers right?

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare

Battlefield is the game that has 60FPS SP on consoles, in CoD they don’t optimize unless it drops below 30fps in a particular area.

item.title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare
